<ProgramListing>

<Link id="l00001" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//===- NaryReassociate.cpp - Reassociate n-ary expressions ----------------===//</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00002" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00003" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// Part of the LLVM Project, under the Apache License v2.0 with LLVM Exceptions.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00004" /><CodeLine lineNumber="4"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// See https://llvm.org/LICENSE.txt for license information.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00005" /><CodeLine lineNumber="5"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// SPDX-License-Identifier: Apache-2.0 WITH LLVM-exception</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00006" /><CodeLine lineNumber="6"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00007" /><CodeLine lineNumber="7"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//===----------------------------------------------------------------------===//</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00008" /><CodeLine lineNumber="8"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00009" /><CodeLine lineNumber="9"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// This pass reassociates n-ary add expressions and eliminates the redundancy</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00010" /><CodeLine lineNumber="10"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// exposed by the reassociation.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00011" /><CodeLine lineNumber="11"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00012" /><CodeLine lineNumber="12"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// A motivating example:</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00013" /><CodeLine lineNumber="13"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00014" /><CodeLine lineNumber="14"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//   void foo(int a, int b) &#123;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00015" /><CodeLine lineNumber="15"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//     bar(a + b);</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00016" /><CodeLine lineNumber="16"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//     bar((a + 2) + b);</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00017" /><CodeLine lineNumber="17"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//   &#125;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00018" /><CodeLine lineNumber="18"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00019" /><CodeLine lineNumber="19"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// An ideal compiler should reassociate (a + 2) + b to (a + b) + 2 and simplify</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00020" /><CodeLine lineNumber="20"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// the above code to</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00021" /><CodeLine lineNumber="21"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00022" /><CodeLine lineNumber="22"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//   int t = a + b;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00023" /><CodeLine lineNumber="23"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//   bar(t);</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00024" /><CodeLine lineNumber="24"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//   bar(t + 2);</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00025" /><CodeLine lineNumber="25"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00026" /><CodeLine lineNumber="26"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// However, the Reassociate pass is unable to do that because it processes each</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00027" /><CodeLine lineNumber="27"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// instruction individually and believes (a + 2) + b is the best form according</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00028" /><CodeLine lineNumber="28"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// to its rank system.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00029" /><CodeLine lineNumber="29"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00030" /><CodeLine lineNumber="30"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// To address this limitation, NaryReassociate reassociates an expression in a</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00031" /><CodeLine lineNumber="31"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// form that reuses existing instructions. As a result, NaryReassociate can</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00032" /><CodeLine lineNumber="32"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// reassociate (a + 2) + b in the example to (a + b) + 2 because it detects that</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00033" /><CodeLine lineNumber="33"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// (a + b) is computed before.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00034" /><CodeLine lineNumber="34"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00035" /><CodeLine lineNumber="35"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// NaryReassociate works as follows. For every instruction in the form of (a +</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00036" /><CodeLine lineNumber="36"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// b) + c, it checks whether a + c or b + c is already computed by a dominating</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00037" /><CodeLine lineNumber="37"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// instruction. If so, it then reassociates (a + b) + c into (a + c) + b or (b +</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00038" /><CodeLine lineNumber="38"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// c) + a and removes the redundancy accordingly. To efficiently look up whether</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00039" /><CodeLine lineNumber="39"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// an expression is computed before, we store each instruction seen and its SCEV</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00040" /><CodeLine lineNumber="40"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// into an SCEV-to-instruction map.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00041" /><CodeLine lineNumber="41"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00042" /><CodeLine lineNumber="42"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// Although the algorithm pattern-matches only ternary additions, it</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00043" /><CodeLine lineNumber="43"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// automatically handles many &gt;3-ary expressions by walking through the function</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00044" /><CodeLine lineNumber="44"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// in the depth-first order. For example, given</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00045" /><CodeLine lineNumber="45"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00046" /><CodeLine lineNumber="46"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//   (a + c) + d</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00047" /><CodeLine lineNumber="47"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//   ((a + b) + c) + d</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00048" /><CodeLine lineNumber="48"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00049" /><CodeLine lineNumber="49"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// NaryReassociate first rewrites (a + b) + c to (a + c) + b, and then rewrites</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00050" /><CodeLine lineNumber="50"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// ((a + c) + b) + d into ((a + c) + d) + b.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00051" /><CodeLine lineNumber="51"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00052" /><CodeLine lineNumber="52"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// Finally, the above dominator-based algorithm may need to be run multiple</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00053" /><CodeLine lineNumber="53"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// iterations before emitting optimal code. One source of this need is that we</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00054" /><CodeLine lineNumber="54"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// only split an operand when it is used only once. The above algorithm can</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00055" /><CodeLine lineNumber="55"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// eliminate an instruction and decrease the usage count of its operands. As a</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00056" /><CodeLine lineNumber="56"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// result, an instruction that previously had multiple uses may become a</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00057" /><CodeLine lineNumber="57"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// single-use instruction and thus eligible for split consideration. For</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00058" /><CodeLine lineNumber="58"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// example,</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00059" /><CodeLine lineNumber="59"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00060" /><CodeLine lineNumber="60"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//   ac = a + c</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00061" /><CodeLine lineNumber="61"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//   ab = a + b</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00062" /><CodeLine lineNumber="62"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//   abc = ab + c</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00063" /><CodeLine lineNumber="63"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//   ab2 = ab + b</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00064" /><CodeLine lineNumber="64"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//   ab2c = ab2 + c</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00065" /><CodeLine lineNumber="65"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00066" /><CodeLine lineNumber="66"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// In the first iteration, we cannot reassociate abc to ac+b because ab is used</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00067" /><CodeLine lineNumber="67"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// twice. However, we can reassociate ab2c to abc+b in the first iteration. As a</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00068" /><CodeLine lineNumber="68"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// result, ab2 becomes dead and ab will be used only once in the second</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00069" /><CodeLine lineNumber="69"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// iteration.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00070" /><CodeLine lineNumber="70"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00071" /><CodeLine lineNumber="71"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// Limitations and TODO items:</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00072" /><CodeLine lineNumber="72"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00073" /><CodeLine lineNumber="73"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// 1) We only considers n-ary adds and muls for now. This should be extended</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00074" /><CodeLine lineNumber="74"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// and generalized.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00075" /><CodeLine lineNumber="75"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00076" /><CodeLine lineNumber="76"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//===----------------------------------------------------------------------===//</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00077" /><CodeLine lineNumber="77"></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00078" /><CodeLine lineNumber="78"><span class="doxyHighlightPreprocessor">#include &quot;<a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/transforms/include/llvm/transforms/scalar/naryreassociate-h">llvm/Transforms/Scalar/NaryReassociate.h</a>&quot;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00079" /><CodeLine lineNumber="79"><span class="doxyHighlightPreprocessor">#include &quot;<a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/adt/depthfirstiterator-h">llvm/ADT/DepthFirstIterator.h</a>&quot;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00080" /><CodeLine lineNumber="80"><span class="doxyHighlightPreprocessor">#include &quot;<a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/adt/smallvector-h">llvm/ADT/SmallVector.h</a>&quot;</span></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00216" /><CodeLine lineNumber="216"><span class="doxyHighlight">&#125;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00217" /><CodeLine lineNumber="217"></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00218" /><CodeLine lineNumber="218"><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordType">bool</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> NaryReassociatePass::doOneIteration(<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/function">Function</a> &amp;<a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/support/md5-cpp/#a96d73bbd7af15cb1fc38c3f4a3bd82e9">F</a>) &#123;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00219" /><CodeLine lineNumber="219"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordType">bool</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> <a href="/docs/api/groups/arcopt/#gaa57b1a4e6a1c79233913139635169cf1">Changed</a> = </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeyword">false</span><span class="doxyHighlight">;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00220" /><CodeLine lineNumber="220"><span class="doxyHighlight">  SeenExprs.clear();</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00221" /><CodeLine lineNumber="221"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// Process the basic blocks in a depth first traversal of the dominator</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00222" /><CodeLine lineNumber="222"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// tree. This order ensures that all bases of a candidate are in Candidates</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00223" /><CodeLine lineNumber="223"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// when we process it.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00224" /><CodeLine lineNumber="224"><span class="doxyHighlight">  <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/smallvector">SmallVector&lt;WeakTrackingVH, 16&gt;</a> DeadInsts;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00225" /><CodeLine lineNumber="225"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordFlow">for</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> (</span><span class="doxyHighlightKeyword">const</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeyword">auto</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> <a href="/docs/api/classes/node">Node</a> : <a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/#ad6e19a09aeed4c56617c284e099c81de">depth&#95;first</a>(DT)) &#123;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00226" /><CodeLine lineNumber="226"><span class="doxyHighlight">    <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/basicblock">BasicBlock</a> &#42;BB = <a href="/docs/api/classes/node">Node</a>-&gt;getBlock();</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00227" /><CodeLine lineNumber="227"><span class="doxyHighlight">    </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordFlow">for</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> (<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/instruction">Instruction</a> &amp;OrigI : &#42;BB) &#123;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00228" /><CodeLine lineNumber="228"><span class="doxyHighlight">      </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeyword">const</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/scev">SCEV</a> &#42;OrigSCEV = </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeyword">nullptr</span><span class="doxyHighlight">;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00229" /><CodeLine lineNumber="229"><span class="doxyHighlight">      </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordFlow">if</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> (<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/instruction">Instruction</a> &#42;NewI = tryReassociate(&amp;OrigI, OrigSCEV)) &#123;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00230" /><CodeLine lineNumber="230"><span class="doxyHighlight">        <a href="/docs/api/groups/arcopt/#gaa57b1a4e6a1c79233913139635169cf1">Changed</a> = </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeyword">true</span><span class="doxyHighlight">;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00231" /><CodeLine lineNumber="231"><span class="doxyHighlight">        OrigI.replaceAllUsesWith(NewI);</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00232" /><CodeLine lineNumber="232"></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00233" /><CodeLine lineNumber="233"><span class="doxyHighlight">        </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// Add &#39;OrigI&#39; to the list of dead instructions.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00234" /><CodeLine lineNumber="234"><span class="doxyHighlight">        DeadInsts.<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/smallvectortemplatebase/#af42bfbc067df27c19ee2fc859df58799">push&#95;back</a>(<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/weaktrackingvh">WeakTrackingVH</a>(&amp;OrigI));</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00235" /><CodeLine lineNumber="235"><span class="doxyHighlight">        </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// Add the rewritten instruction to SeenExprs; the original</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00236" /><CodeLine lineNumber="236"><span class="doxyHighlight">        </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// instruction is deleted.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00237" /><CodeLine lineNumber="237"><span class="doxyHighlight">        </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeyword">const</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/scev">SCEV</a> &#42;NewSCEV = SE-&gt;<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/scalarevolution/#a30bd18ac905eacf3601bc6a553a9ff49">getSCEV</a>(NewI);</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00238" /><CodeLine lineNumber="238"><span class="doxyHighlight">        SeenExprs&#91;NewSCEV&#93;.push&#95;back(<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/weaktrackingvh">WeakTrackingVH</a>(NewI));</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00239" /><CodeLine lineNumber="239"></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00240" /><CodeLine lineNumber="240"><span class="doxyHighlight">        </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// Ideally, NewSCEV should equal OldSCEV because tryReassociate(I)</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00241" /><CodeLine lineNumber="241"><span class="doxyHighlight">        </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// is equivalent to I. However, ScalarEvolution::getSCEV may</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00242" /><CodeLine lineNumber="242"><span class="doxyHighlight">        </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// weaken nsw causing NewSCEV not to equal OldSCEV. For example,</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00243" /><CodeLine lineNumber="243"><span class="doxyHighlight">        </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// suppose we reassociate</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00244" /><CodeLine lineNumber="244"><span class="doxyHighlight">        </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//   I = &amp;a&#91;sext(i +nsw j)&#93; // assuming sizeof(a&#91;0&#93;) = 4</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00245" /><CodeLine lineNumber="245"><span class="doxyHighlight">        </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// to</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00246" /><CodeLine lineNumber="246"><span class="doxyHighlight">        </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//   NewI = &amp;a&#91;sext(i)&#93; + sext(j).</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00247" /><CodeLine lineNumber="247"><span class="doxyHighlight">        </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00248" /><CodeLine lineNumber="248"><span class="doxyHighlight">        </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// ScalarEvolution computes</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00249" /><CodeLine lineNumber="249"><span class="doxyHighlight">        </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//   getSCEV(I)    = a + 4 &#42; sext(i + j)</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00250" /><CodeLine lineNumber="250"><span class="doxyHighlight">        </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//   getSCEV(newI) = a + 4 &#42; sext(i) + 4 &#42; sext(j)</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00251" /><CodeLine lineNumber="251"><span class="doxyHighlight">        </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// which are different SCEVs.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00252" /><CodeLine lineNumber="252"><span class="doxyHighlight">        </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00253" /><CodeLine lineNumber="253"><span class="doxyHighlight">        </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// To alleviate this issue of ScalarEvolution not always capturing</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00254" /><CodeLine lineNumber="254"><span class="doxyHighlight">        </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// equivalence, we add I to SeenExprs&#91;OldSCEV&#93; as well so that we can</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00255" /><CodeLine lineNumber="255"><span class="doxyHighlight">        </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// map both SCEV before and after tryReassociate(I) to I.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00256" /><CodeLine lineNumber="256"><span class="doxyHighlight">        </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00257" /><CodeLine lineNumber="257"><span class="doxyHighlight">        </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// This improvement is exercised in @reassociate&#95;gep&#95;nsw in</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00258" /><CodeLine lineNumber="258"><span class="doxyHighlight">        </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// nary-gep.ll.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00259" /><CodeLine lineNumber="259"><span class="doxyHighlight">        </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordFlow">if</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> (NewSCEV != OrigSCEV)</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00260" /><CodeLine lineNumber="260"><span class="doxyHighlight">          SeenExprs&#91;OrigSCEV&#93;.push&#95;back(<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/weaktrackingvh">WeakTrackingVH</a>(NewI));</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00261" /><CodeLine lineNumber="261"><span class="doxyHighlight">      &#125; </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordFlow">else</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordFlow">if</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> (OrigSCEV)</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00262" /><CodeLine lineNumber="262"><span class="doxyHighlight">        SeenExprs&#91;OrigSCEV&#93;.push&#95;back(<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/weaktrackingvh">WeakTrackingVH</a>(&amp;OrigI));</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00263" /><CodeLine lineNumber="263"><span class="doxyHighlight">    &#125;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00264" /><CodeLine lineNumber="264"><span class="doxyHighlight">  &#125;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00265" /><CodeLine lineNumber="265"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// Delete all dead instructions from &#39;DeadInsts&#39;.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00266" /><CodeLine lineNumber="266"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// Please note ScalarEvolution is updated along the way.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00267" /><CodeLine lineNumber="267"><span class="doxyHighlight">  <a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/#abca8e2c525d8162fbcbb5b444cf04d21">RecursivelyDeleteTriviallyDeadInstructionsPermissive</a>(</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00268" /><CodeLine lineNumber="268"><span class="doxyHighlight">      DeadInsts, TLI, </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeyword">nullptr</span><span class="doxyHighlight">, &#91;</span><span class="doxyHighlightKeyword">this</span><span class="doxyHighlight">&#93;(<a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/#a066e2a31a13d6520e52ae1944f194662">Value</a> &#42;V) &#123; SE-&gt;forgetValue(V); &#125;);</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00269" /><CodeLine lineNumber="269"></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00270" /><CodeLine lineNumber="270"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordFlow">return</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> <a href="/docs/api/groups/arcopt/#gaa57b1a4e6a1c79233913139635169cf1">Changed</a>;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00271" /><CodeLine lineNumber="271"><span class="doxyHighlight">&#125;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00272" /><CodeLine lineNumber="272"></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00273" /><CodeLine lineNumber="273"><span class="doxyHighlightKeyword">template</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> &lt;</span><span class="doxyHighlightKeyword">typename</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> PredT&gt;</span></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00442" /><CodeLine lineNumber="442"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// sizeof(S) = 100 is indivisible by sizeof(int64) = 8</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00443" /><CodeLine lineNumber="443"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//</span></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00552" /><CodeLine lineNumber="552"><span class="doxyHighlight">NaryReassociatePass::findClosestMatchingDominator(</span><span class="doxyHighlightKeyword">const</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/scev">SCEV</a> &#42;CandidateExpr,</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00553" /><CodeLine lineNumber="553"><span class="doxyHighlight">                                                  <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/instruction">Instruction</a> &#42;Dominatee) &#123;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00554" /><CodeLine lineNumber="554"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeyword">auto</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> Pos = SeenExprs.find(CandidateExpr);</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00555" /><CodeLine lineNumber="555"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordFlow">if</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> (Pos == SeenExprs.end())</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00556" /><CodeLine lineNumber="556"><span class="doxyHighlight">    </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordFlow">return</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeyword">nullptr</span><span class="doxyHighlight">;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00557" /><CodeLine lineNumber="557"></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00558" /><CodeLine lineNumber="558"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeyword">auto</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> &amp;Candidates = Pos-&gt;second;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00559" /><CodeLine lineNumber="559"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// Because we process the basic blocks in pre-order of the dominator tree, a</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00560" /><CodeLine lineNumber="560"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// candidate that doesn&#39;t dominate the current instruction won&#39;t dominate any</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00561" /><CodeLine lineNumber="561"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// future instruction either. Therefore, we pop it out of the stack. This</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00562" /><CodeLine lineNumber="562"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// optimization makes the algorithm O(n).</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00563" /><CodeLine lineNumber="563"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordFlow">while</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> (!Candidates.empty()) &#123;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00564" /><CodeLine lineNumber="564"><span class="doxyHighlight">    </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// Candidates stores WeakTrackingVHs, so a candidate can be nullptr if it&#39;s</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00565" /><CodeLine lineNumber="565"><span class="doxyHighlight">    </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// removed during rewriting.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00566" /><CodeLine lineNumber="566"><span class="doxyHighlight">    </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordFlow">if</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> (<a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/#a066e2a31a13d6520e52ae1944f194662">Value</a> &#42;Candidate = Candidates.pop&#95;back&#95;val()) &#123;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00567" /><CodeLine lineNumber="567"><span class="doxyHighlight">      <a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/sandboxir/#a75d3582b0f0bc7a5123de92ada301e97">Instruction</a> &#42;CandidateInstruction = <a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/#ac4fc845f5ed92de63cd4474f128f5fc5">cast&lt;Instruction&gt;</a>(Candidate);</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00568" /><CodeLine lineNumber="568"><span class="doxyHighlight">      </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordFlow">if</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> (!DT-&gt;dominates(CandidateInstruction, Dominatee))</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00569" /><CodeLine lineNumber="569"><span class="doxyHighlight">        </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordFlow">continue</span><span class="doxyHighlight">;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00570" /><CodeLine lineNumber="570"></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00571" /><CodeLine lineNumber="571"><span class="doxyHighlight">      </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// Make sure that the instruction is safe to reuse without introducing</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00572" /><CodeLine lineNumber="572"><span class="doxyHighlight">      </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// poison.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00573" /><CodeLine lineNumber="573"><span class="doxyHighlight">      SmallVector&lt;Instruction &#42;&gt; DropPoisonGeneratingInsts;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00574" /><CodeLine lineNumber="574"><span class="doxyHighlight">      </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordFlow">if</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> (!SE-&gt;canReuseInstruction(CandidateExpr, CandidateInstruction,</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00575" /><CodeLine lineNumber="575"><span class="doxyHighlight">                                   DropPoisonGeneratingInsts))</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00576" /><CodeLine lineNumber="576"><span class="doxyHighlight">        </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordFlow">continue</span><span class="doxyHighlight">;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00577" /><CodeLine lineNumber="577"></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00578" /><CodeLine lineNumber="578"><span class="doxyHighlight">      </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordFlow">for</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> (Instruction &#42;<a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/support/md5-cpp/#ac0eafdc9ee161b71e7af98af736952fd">I</a> : DropPoisonGeneratingInsts)</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00579" /><CodeLine lineNumber="579"><span class="doxyHighlight">        <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/support/md5-cpp/#ac0eafdc9ee161b71e7af98af736952fd">I</a>-&gt;dropPoisonGeneratingAnnotations();</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00580" /><CodeLine lineNumber="580"></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00581" /><CodeLine lineNumber="581"><span class="doxyHighlight">      </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordFlow">return</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> CandidateInstruction;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00582" /><CodeLine lineNumber="582"><span class="doxyHighlight">    &#125;</span></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00601" /><CodeLine lineNumber="601"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// Parameters:</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00602" /><CodeLine lineNumber="602"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//  I - instruction matched by MaxMinMatch matcher</span></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00606" /><CodeLine lineNumber="606"><span class="doxyHighlightKeyword">template</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> &lt;</span><span class="doxyHighlightKeyword">typename</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> MaxMinT&gt;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00607" /><CodeLine lineNumber="607"><span class="doxyHighlight"><a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/value">Value</a> &#42;NaryReassociatePass::tryReassociateMinOrMax(<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/instruction">Instruction</a> &#42;<a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/support/md5-cpp/#ac0eafdc9ee161b71e7af98af736952fd">I</a>,</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00608" /><CodeLine lineNumber="608"><span class="doxyHighlight">                                                   MaxMinT MaxMinMatch,</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00609" /><CodeLine lineNumber="609"><span class="doxyHighlight">                                                   <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/value">Value</a> &#42;<a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/x86/x86partialreduction-cpp/#a9e1483f7215664a2315c53c3558d9a8d">LHS</a>, <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/value">Value</a> &#42;<a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/x86/x86partialreduction-cpp/#a87b8bfbbe9d8f7146d7f20a5fb42efd0">RHS</a>) &#123;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00610" /><CodeLine lineNumber="610"><span class="doxyHighlight">  <a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/#a066e2a31a13d6520e52ae1944f194662">Value</a> &#42;<a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/ir/builtingcs-cpp/#a2e38c85003a042421cde1647632d0b72">A</a> = </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeyword">nullptr</span><span class="doxyHighlight">, &#42;<a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/ir/builtingcs-cpp/#ae76959fe811ba090de4cba69ac00f1da">B</a> = </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeyword">nullptr</span><span class="doxyHighlight">;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00611" /><CodeLine lineNumber="611"><span class="doxyHighlight">  MaxMinT m&#95;MaxMin(<a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/patternmatch/#aaf522908fe903018eb9b087dd6e49296">m&#95;Value</a>(<a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/ir/builtingcs-cpp/#a2e38c85003a042421cde1647632d0b72">A</a>), <a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/patternmatch/#aaf522908fe903018eb9b087dd6e49296">m&#95;Value</a>(<a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/ir/builtingcs-cpp/#ae76959fe811ba090de4cba69ac00f1da">B</a>));</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00612" /><CodeLine lineNumber="612"></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00613" /><CodeLine lineNumber="613"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordFlow">if</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> (<a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/x86/x86partialreduction-cpp/#a9e1483f7215664a2315c53c3558d9a8d">LHS</a>-&gt;<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/value/#a72fb137716cff838d389e392b9729dc9">hasNUsesOrMore</a>(3) ||</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00614" /><CodeLine lineNumber="614"><span class="doxyHighlight">      </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// The optimization is profitable only if LHS can be removed in the end.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00615" /><CodeLine lineNumber="615"><span class="doxyHighlight">      </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// In other words LHS should be used (directly or indirectly) by I only.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00616" /><CodeLine lineNumber="616"><span class="doxyHighlight">      <a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/#a61d13d6824ec46c31260a4fd0997eda0">llvm::any&#95;of</a>(<a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/x86/x86partialreduction-cpp/#a9e1483f7215664a2315c53c3558d9a8d">LHS</a>-&gt;<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/value/#a411cf3e3932f209ce3374cb31adc1da6">users</a>(),</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00617" /><CodeLine lineNumber="617"><span class="doxyHighlight">                    &#91;&amp;&#93;(</span><span class="doxyHighlightKeyword">auto</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> &#42;U) &#123;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00618" /><CodeLine lineNumber="618"><span class="doxyHighlight">                      return U != I &amp;&amp;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00619" /><CodeLine lineNumber="619"><span class="doxyHighlight">                             !(U-&gt;hasOneUser() &amp;&amp; &#42;U-&gt;users().begin() == I);</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00620" /><CodeLine lineNumber="620"><span class="doxyHighlight">                    &#125;) ||</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00621" /><CodeLine lineNumber="621"><span class="doxyHighlight">      !<a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/patternmatch/#a25d956d9e0beadd47ce4bc255dfa811d">match</a>(<a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/x86/x86partialreduction-cpp/#a9e1483f7215664a2315c53c3558d9a8d">LHS</a>, m&#95;MaxMin))</span></CodeLine>
